review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review:
Ok so this is actually a nice indie game but there are a few things that need to be fixed in future versions:
1. The music that repeats in the background is not really "loopable". So the music stops and starts with a interruption
2. The reset should not only be accessible via mouse (either instant respawn or via click of enter or r-key or something like that
3. The jumping feels a little bit weird but i don't know why
4 the menu should be a little bit better organized eg don't let every menupoint move and make the background colors a little bit less colourfull so that it becomes obvious what is a menupoint and what is background
5. the loadingscreen should not be black
6. the collision mask should be editet (i sometimes walk against a floating block whilst staying on it)
7. the movement should be editable/create an options menu (I hate using arrowkeyes)
8. remove the running animation if the up and down arrowkeyes are pressed
9.i dont know if its intended, but you can stay on those background light thingys
and last but not least going back through a portal would be nice.
But overall a nice little game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998177676', 'num_games_owned': 4911, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1502314716}
review:
This... isn't even that horrible. Coming from this devs later game; Cavern Escape which was an abomination it's rather shocking how much better this game made a half year earlier is. Aren't devs supposed to improve?
Having said that I don't really like it too much myself, but that's because I dont really like platforms too much. If you do, I don't see why you can't have some cheap fun with this. To compare to the "sequel" since it's basically the same game (ugh);

* Can actually be controlled properly. Like an actual platform.
* Still has insta-death applenty, but seems overall fair here. Overall. Has some strange invisible walls on sections with elevation though, which makes no sense. Also having to play with keyboard and restart after death with mouse still sucks.
* Music loops after a whole 10 SECONDS... which is more than can be said of the 3S of Cavern. Still probably best turned off ASAP.
* Is actually able to count to 2. Not sure why the developer could in 2016, but lost that ability in 2017.
* Still windowed, no options.

After coming from Cavern I was expecting to fully rip this game to shreds, but it's actually not that bad a platformer. Definitely seen way way WAY worse on Steam with much better scores than mostly negative. So yeah, figured I should reward that with a review stating so, even though I have no idea what the hell happened a half-year down the line.

EDIT: And then after having to close the game to make Steam realise I played it for 5m to post this review and restarting it, it seems to have locked a few levels I have actually reached. Greeeat. Well, I tried. You've had your upvote for about 3 minutes.

review:
I can't recommend this game yet for a few reasons until they are fixed (although you should give it a try) but so far here are the pros and cons


Pros : 
- It's a pretty fun and very simple platforming game to kill your spare time
- It's very cheap and not overpriced
- You can finish this game in a maximum of 2 hours even if you're THAT bad
- There are only around 30-ish levels but I am sure the developers will add more
- The background is a bit too flashy for me but it looks beautiful for a game with pixel graphics like that (16-bit? Is that what it's called?)


Cons :
- The hitboxes are weird and wonky
- Sometimes there are invisible hitboxes that stops you when you're jumping, running, etc which can either get you stuck or killed in some levels (this is a pretty major problem please fix this)
- Lack of levels, which isn't much of a problem for me but maybe to some other people
- The soundtrack is the same in every world and levels and they loop which is sort of annoying for me


Overall, it's an alright game that I would not recommend yet (but again, you should give it a try) because of it's lack of levels and weird hitboxes. I hope this review helps you :D 
\(Oh and non grav mode is the best mode, I'm just saying)

author: {'steamid': '76561198112810429', 'num_games_owned': 2594, 'num_reviews': 578, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1491859880}
review:
One more indie game with Steam cards and less content to play than the time that you need to unlock all the cards.
"Dynamic" is a short 2d platformer, where you jump, dive and run through some obstacles. Some levels could be even challenging... But, then again, the most of the levels are just one screen, so, you'll pass it, if you have at least some skill with platformers.

Visuals - obviously - quite bad. Controls - even worse. Especially the moments where you have to restart the level by clicking the mouse button and then right away hitting a jump button and whatnot... Since some levels are starting with you falling on the spikes, or cannonball flying to your face... Usual underdog stuff "like in the Mario editor".

Final verdict - lame 3 out of 10. I get it for free, as a gift, but I wouldn't advise anyone to buy such game even with the 90% discount. It's simply below the level. There are thousands of better 2d platformers anyways.

review:
The game basically conists out of three worlds with a tiny amount of levels each. My first experience of the game was actually nice, though after playing it for a bit I kept noticing what low amount of effort was put into actually fixing the Bugs. I was gifted this game, though honestly I would have fallen for it and bought it by the screenshots. The art style as I have said is amazing, though there's so many flaws behind it. Here's a few:
- You keep getting stuck on edges
- You die randomly out of nowhere
- The game crsahes out of nowhere

Here's a few more things about it:
- The mouse/keyboard combination is terribly done. If you fail a level your cursor stays in the middle of the screen and annoys you
- The game takes ages to load
- Some bugs could have been fixed through a simple playtest, therefor I can't believe an appropriate amount of time was put into the game's testing whatsoever. Making a game is hard though some extents of playtesting are just needed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051833438', 'num_games_owned': 6280, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1479787083}
review:
I normally write longer reviews but this game does not deserve the time required for one.

The graphics in the game are somewhat cute, and the soundtrack is not quite terrible enough for me to bemoan it - I've heard worse, of course the looping does get tedious. Those are the only good things I can say about the game, if in fact they count as good.

The controls and the responsiveness in the game are utter garbage, your little critter just goes with the momentum as if he is a ball bearing, and always jumps at the same height and with the same trajectory. You will die often, not because you make mistakes but because of the choices the developers made. Some games are challenging because the level design is tough, others are challenging because your foes are terrifying, this game is challenging because you're battling the controls the whole time you play it. Blatant fake difficulty and a pseudo-challenge; your success in the game is not determined by your skill as a player, you're simply crippled by bad programming and over the top "physics". And with few redeeming qualities to recommend the game, any player with choices in their library (aka all steam users) is not likely to want to continue playing Dynamic past a few minutes.

One very annoying little feature is that when I die, and I died a lot, I had to click restart with the mouse, when I'm playing the whole time with a keyboard... why?

[b]Overall score: 3/10[/b] - it isn't a 1 because the theme is cute and the game costs 2$, but you're better off buying a coffee with that money.
